pullRequest.title: 6163 New panel for type filtering in the geolocation tool

commit.message: New panel for type filtering in the geolocation tool
6163: Icons for artifact types in geolocation

nodes.bodyText: the state of checkbox and label enabled should be the same as list.
Make sure to note in the method header that Icon maybe null.
Just to appease netbeans create a private init function and put setLayout and the adds in that function.  That will make the light bulbs in netbeans go away.
My mistake, please change comment to "Update if other GPS artifacts are added"
Why are you keeping count?  You are not adding the type unless count is greater than one.  I just don't think you need to keep count.
Different OSs use different path separators, ie \ vs /.  use Paths.get instead
Make sure the method header is updated.

I am a little torn about whether to do this or include the types in the query.  Was there a reason that you didn't look at extending the query?  It might be too messy.  That figuring out the query was a pain.

This is missing TSK_EXIF_METADATA
Also as Ann points out in the Jira, using these hardcode types (which is my fault) makes it so that we cannot support custom artifacts).
After talking with Richard about issues related to the support of custom artifacts I think they way you are doing this sufficient for now.

There are two issues there.   I get a NPE here.  When I step through the code icon path was

The use of File.separator is not correct here.  Since you are loading a resource from the jar file I don't believe that the direction of the slash is file dependent.

If you need to put that / at the beginning of the image file path why is it not being done in getIconFilePath?  It does make sense that ever that calls that function would have to add a / at the beginning of the path.
